result.execSummary:
The defendant Jared Taylor Ricci was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500), Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to 17CF529 and Minnesota Probation.
Defendant to sign up for Probation.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #16CM6.
Apply bond to DNA surcharge.

-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested by the Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's. 
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Fleet Farm in Hudson WI.
-Defendant to report to the Day Report Center to provide a DNA sample.
-Follow rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA to be completed within 30 days and follow any recommended treatment.

11:08 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Rohan, ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Christopher Stephen Petros   DF:  Jared Taylor Ricci appeared from jail. Includes: 16CM06, 17CF529, 18CF01, 18CF179, 18CF374. ADA Minser recites agreement. Atty Petros states DEF is on Probation in MN and has a condition to enter treatment, DEF has a plan to reside in WI and MN depending on probation requirements. Court questions Bail Jumping charges. Atty Petros responds. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads G to Ct 1 in 16CM06 and G to Ct 1 in 17CF529. Court questions Defendant. Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Attorneys stipulate to facts. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant Guilty. On Motion of State without objection, Court dismisses Ct 2 in 17CF529 and cases 18CF01, 18CF179, 18CF374. Sentencing arguments. Atty Petros provides proof programming DEF completed while in custody. DEF addresses Court. Court Orders:
16CM06 - Ct 1 - Sent W/H -  1 year probation with conditions concurrent to 17CF529:
- Court Costs: $243
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200; Apply Bond
- Costs payable through probation
- 240 Days Jail STAYED
- AODA completed within 30 days and follow through
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- Not to possess a firearm
- No contact with Fleet Farm in Hudson, WI
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation

17CF529 - Ct 1 - Sent W/H - 3 years probation with conditions concurrent to 16CM06:
- Court Costs: $268
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250
- Costs payable through probation
- 240 Days Jail STAYED
- AODA completed within 30 days and follow through
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- Not to possess a firearm
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
-Sign up for probation

-25 days credit against ultimate sentence

Probation on 17CF529 and 16CM06 concurrent to probation DEF is currently serving in MN.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 14, 2019 at 11:00 am.

Per RMW 5/19/16 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
Pre-trial conference on July 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Bond on file.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Fleet Farm in Hudson WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.
